data: GENDERSURG Phalloplasty Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to Initiate Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the Inpatient Unit
Discontinue GENDERSURG Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Pre Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
Refer to ERAS clinical pathway for Phalloplasty
QID before food and bedtime, Upon arrival to PACU
Encourage gum chewing for 15 minutes PO TID (when awake until day of discharge)
Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Flap Temperature, Assess Doppler Signal, Assess Finger Temperature, q1h, For 72 hour
T+3;N, Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Flap Temperature, Assess Doppler Signal, Assess Finger Temperature, q2h, For 48 hour
T+5;N, Assess Flap Color, Assess Flap Turgor, Assess Flap Capillary Refill, Assess Flap Temperature, Assess Doppler Signal, Assess Finger Temperature, q4h, Until discharge
Venous Doppler, Implantable Doppler, Site: Phallus, Keep continuous for first 2 hour. Then monitor intermittently at q1h for 72 hour, then q2h for 48 hour, then q4h until discharge
Arterial Doppler, Site: Phallus, Monitor q1h for 72 hour, then q2h for 48 hour, then q4h for 48 hour, until discharge
Check for constriction at pedicle location. Avoid tight dressings, splints, ties, external pressure over pedicle
Notify provider per order comments criteria
Ensure no tension to urethral catheter (used as stent)
q6h, Measure suprapubic catheter output until discontinued
If urinary output less than 100 mL over 4 hour
Remove penrose drain on post-op day_____
Empty and Record Output q6h, Strip q1h for 4 hour, then q6h PRN
Discontinue hemovac drain when drainage less than _____ mL in 24 hour
See reference link for ERAS Gender Surgery Clinical Pathway
On post-op day 5 or 6: ambulate to standing/walking with phallus always protected and pointing upwards (using mesh underwear). Avoid sitting more than 10 minutes
Encourage patient to do ERAS leg and arm exercises
Air driven temperature management blanket over patient
Venous Thromboembolism (VTE) Prophylaxis - Post Operative Surgery (Module)
4 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: inj, start: T;2200
4 mg, PO, q8h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: tab, start: T+1;2200
4 mg, IV, q8h, PRN nausea or vomiting, drug form: inj, start: T+1;2200

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 2 day, drug form: bag
500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 2 day, drug form: bag
amoxicillin-clavulanate 875 mg-125 mg tab (dosed as amoxicillin)
875 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab, start: T+2;0800
400 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 2 day, drug form: bag
500 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 2 day, drug form: bag
500 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab, start: T+2;0800
500 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab, start: T+2;0800
81 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 30 day, drug form: tab-EC
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
See ERAS clinical pathway for discharge criteria
Upon arrival, q1h for 2 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h until discharge
Upon arrival, then q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hour, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
Upon arrival, q1h for 2 hour, then q4h for 24 hour, then q6h until discharge
Upon arrival, then  q4h for 48 hour, then q8h for 48 hours, then q12h for 24 hour, then qdaily until discharge
If new fever greater than 38.5 degC
T+1;N, On post-op day 1, when drinking well
Radial Forearm Donor Site with Integra
Site: Radial forearm donor site, Dressing type: Other (please specify), use: Integra
Half slab cast to be removed by OT and Thermoplastic splint made between post-op day 1 to 3

Site: Radial forearm donor site, Therapy type: VAC, 125 mmHg, Pressure interval: Continuous, Do not instil with sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) prior to VAC removal with Integra. For nursing concerns, notify PLASURG
Radial Forearm Donor Site with split-thickness skin graft (STSG)
Site: STSG donor site, Dressing type: Aquacel Ag | Transparent film, Aspirate transparent drape with small gauge needle PRN
Half slab cast to be removed by OT and Thermoplastic splint made between post-op day 1 to 3
Therapy type: Split thickness skin graft, 125 mmHg, Pressure interval: Continuous
Site: STSG donor site, Dressing type: Aquacel Ag | Transparent film, Aspirate transparent drape with small gauge needle PRN
Therapy type: VAC, 125 mmHg, Pressure interval: Continuous
Active patient warming in warm room up to 27 to 30 degC
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Start: Clear Fluid Diet, Adjust/Advance Diet to: Other (Please Specify)
Except for Medications, 1 day, Post-op day 0
Except for Ice Chips, 1 day, Post-op day 0
